intro: Tisonia glabrata, commonly known as the smooth tisonia, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in the summer. Tisonia glabrata is often found in moist, tropical environments and can thrive in partial shade. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists alike.
